alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 3:54PM PST until December 27 at 11:04PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon and Washington... Nehalem River near Foss affecting Clatsop and Tillamook Counties. Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Tualatin River near Dilley affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 12.0 feet, minor flooding of low lying dairy and pasture land north and east of Tillamook can be expected, particularly during high tides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM PST Tuesday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling through Wednesday. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Don`t drive through flooded areas. Find another route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/portland. The next statement will be issued by 4 AM PST Wednesday.
